channel.title: Reversing on The Arcade
channel.description: Recent content in Reversing on The Arcade

item.title: RemcosRat Dropper Stage
item.description: Contains the first stage of malware analysis for RemcosRat

item.title: Telegram C2 InfoStealer
item.description: Contains the malware analysis of the suspicious file “GENERATED30”

item.title: Rust Ransomware Analysis
item.description:
tl;dr

  • Challenge 2 of Batman Investigation series
  • Ransomware Investigation
  • Rust based Ransomware Analysis with process dump analysis to recover the randomly generated decryption vector and windows malware analysis
  • Recovering from a ransomware attack

item.title: Vessel Cartographer HTBCTF23
item.description:
tl;dr

  • Dynamically resolved hashed API
  • Tls_call_back based anti-debug check
  • AntiDebugFlag check implemented using ProcessInformationClass
  • AES_CBC decryption of image to find flag

item.title: Popping a calculator - 32 bit - Part 3/3
item.description: Writing the Shellcode x86 W32 # 32 bit also goes through the same steps as 64 bits so I woudn’t be explaining it in detail rather, I have commented it on the side for you to understand and pick up based on context from x64

item.title: Popping a calculator - 64 bit - Part 2/3
item.description: Writing the Shellcode x64 # This part of the blog covers the 64 bit shellcode to pop a calculator.

item.title: Popping a calculator - Basic - Part 1/3
item.description: Windows Shellcoding Series 1 - Part 1/3 # Popping a calculator # Init() # Now in the series I would be covering both the 64 bit and 32 bit versions of the shellcode to pop a calculator and would go about explaining them both separately.

item.title: Windows Shellcoding Series 0
item.description: Windows Shellcoding Series 0 # Init() # Welcome to the prequel blogpost of my Shellcoding Series With this I intend to start of a series of Shellcoding based blogposts aiming to develop and post interesting shellcodes
